website_summaries.verdict: A fine camera, the Canon EOS Rebel T4i's more expensive 18-135mm STM kit (or body with another STM lens) is the only version that merits an unqualified recommendation. You can probably find better alternatives if you just want a sub-$1,000 dSLR for still photography.
pros: The Canon EOS Rebel T4i delivers extremely good photo and video quality plus improved performance in Live View shooting over the T3i -- as long as you buy the more expensive 18-135mm STM kit
Plus, the camera has a more streamlined shooting design than its predecessor
cons: The feature set remains rather blah, and its photos aren't as good as the T3i's at high ISO sensitivities

customer_reviews.title: if the Dog's Bollocks and Cat's Meow got together
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera almost two years ago and I still am in love it! SO glad I got the T4i instead of the T3i, The touch screen is something that initially I thought wouldn't matter but after using a friend's T3i, I realized how much I love my touch screen. More menu features as well compared to the T3i and although both are great, I am very happy with the T4i. I have since added several lenses to my kit and although I have joined an accessories addiction group, I am very happy with this purchase - and have convinced others to purchase the camera and they tell me they are very satisfied when I see them at group.
customer_reviews.author: LKR505

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stills, amazing video
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my beloved EOS Rebel XSi which snapped 50,000 pictures in the years I owned it. So the T4i had a lot to live up to and it does it without any trouble at all. It's faster, clearer, easier to use, has more features and shoots incredible video. Once you have a video camera with replaceable lenses you'll never go back. My only gripe is the autofocus motor noise when recording video. The mic sits right on top of the camera and if you don't have a STM lens you'll hear the autofocus motor. I just ordered an external mic so that should solve the problem. Other than that Canon hit a home run with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Live Without It
customer_reviews.text: Anybody looking to get into photography and/or videography should look no further. This is a great camera for the price and is packed with features. If you're looking to use the video feature, the swivel screen is so handy. If you're super serious the stereo mic isn't too important, but it's easily one of the best mics on a DSLR. I've found that I don't use the touch screen that much, but it really does help when you need to switch some settings quickly. I've always told people if you're just getting into photography, don't look to invest in the body too much, invest in lenses. Save some money, get this body, and look up to pick up another lens.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded from a T3i.. I just got it and i'm already impressed
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked well.... the new auto focus (versus the previous generations) is interesting and has worked well for the brief time i've used it so far. It has better light/low light sensitivity. Better video and the controls are improved so you can start-stop video recording independently. This is great for me as I intend to use the camera for both photos and video. This is an improvement over the previous generation and they have new lenses which take advantage of the auto focus for shooting video. Those supposedly have a quiet USM type motor which is silent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: My first DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I was needing to upgrade from a [fairly good] point-shoot camera. So when this camera was on sale, I decided to pull the trigger, and have been very happy with it. One of the advantages of this camera over cheap[er] point and shoots is the speed. Maybe more expensive cameras are faster, but I can shoot as soon as I can turn it on and get it to my eye. (I don't use the Live view setting much at all, except to take video.) The video capability is very nice. Again, my first Full HD device, so I REALLY like it, and it works for me very well. Very likely other cameras/camcorders do better, but I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: A great pro-sumer DSLR
customer_reviews.text: If you're not getting paid for your photos, this will be all the camera you'll ever need. You can attach any Canon lens made for DSLRs (or third-party lenses with Canon mounts). Add any accessories you need. The battery grip is great for extended shooting. Add an LED video light or a flash, etc. Video mode on this camera is excellent, and if you use one of the new USM lenses for quiet focusing, you'll be set. There's very little you can't do with this camera that the bigger-brother "D" models can do.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Solid Reliable Performance
customer_reviews.text: Durable and reliable without cumbersome extras. This was my first transition to DSLR from film after years of deliberation, still my solid go-to. Adapts well to lenses, Canon software allows lens correction or refinement with output and raw process options.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, easy to use camera
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research when I was ready to purchase a DSLR camers and I have had the Canon brand for 30+ years so I wanted to stick with Canon. The Rebel T4i is an amazing camera and so very easy to use. I am learning the ins and outs of its opperation and have volumes to learn about all of its functions but have not been at all disappointed with any pictures I have taken. The colors and textures it brings out are amazing! This is a camera I will enthusiastically recommend to anyone who wants to take their photography up another level without having to spend the BIG bucks!
customer_reviews.author: L. Linnell

customer_reviews.title: I REGRET NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: At the time i bought the T4i was going for $842.81 refurbished. Now you can purchase one for $200 less! but I REGRET NOTHING! I have used it many times since its arrival in November. The flip out, touch screen is an added plus and makes filming a breeze. Instead of bending, squatting or contorting my body in any way the the flip out screen cuts that out. If you have the money like I did and are wondering whether to buy this specific canon or any other canons you should really look up Dave Dugdale and his hands on review on the T4i and the Canon 60D. His video review helped me out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: nezimon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my NEW CANON REBEL!
customer_reviews.text: The seller name's Echozoe has done what she said she will do and that is MOST important to me....her words and integrity which build trust between us worked out great! I suggested to here to use USPM to reduced the shipping cost and she did plus she even paid the extra charge w/o charging me. I received the Canon Rebel T4i today in perfect condition and it's working great. I LOVE THIS camera! Thank you so much Echoezoe and if I see your name again on the seller list, I will choose u first among the other sellers. Have a great day, Jim Lee
customer_reviews.author: jim lee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera about a year ago. I don't know how I ever got along without it. It is easy to use for basic pictures. And if you want to experiment with your picture taking there are plenty of settings you can practice with. Love the fact that I can see the picture now and erase it if it is not the shot I was trying to capture. The touch screen is awesome too. So many pluses, I can't begin to list them all! Cannon did a great job producing a great camera at an affordable price. I just wish I had more time to use it.
customer_reviews.author: D Wright

customer_reviews.title: Dream camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful camera. My "grands" look so awesome in the pictures. I am very inexperienced with any type of camera except a point and shoot and took this out of the box, put on the lens and off I went out into the yard to figure it out. Surprisingly the pictures turned out great. I've been reading the instruction book and it's very user friendly. I look forward to many "great" pictures with this fine instrument! I can't offer expert advice but for a novice it has been great....happy snapping!
customer_reviews.author: pearl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to move up from point & shoot, and after watching several reviews by professional photographers on the T4i, I purchased one and I love it more everyday. There are a few professionals on Youtube who have numerous videos that explain all aspects of this camera. I purchased the T4i bundled with the ER-S 55-250mm lens, and since have purchased both the 50mm f/1.4 and the 40mm f/2.8. I'm amazed at how much I've learned, and how many tricks you can do with this camera. I highly recommend it for anybody looking to step into the world of DSLR photography.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this investment
customer_reviews.text: I will always start by saying, do your research on what you want. I am in love with this investment. It's user friendly and easy to grasp settings and template were a great help as I'm just start on my photography and video journey. The quality of the video footage is the main reason I chose this particular model. It is less grainy and allows for smoother action shots. I appreciate the touch screen capability as I have been able to master recording myself in certain shots. This is an beginning indie filmmakers best friend. Well...it's mine at least! Good purchase. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Rebel T4i a few weeks ago. It easily surpassed my expectations. The picture quality is exceptional, it is very easy it use and has a myriad of features, including shooting videos (which are at very high quality). Ultimately, I believe this is the best camera under $2000 (The Canon EOS 5D will then take the crown). This is simply one of the best cameras on the market and the better quality only improves with the quality of the lens you purchase. At this price, it is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing DSLR
customer_reviews.text: The Canon EOS Rebel T4i is an amazing DSLR. The specs are great, as are the images. The images are crisp, clear and sharp and very large (18 MP) -- overall, everything looks great. The touch screen works great, as does the entire camera. I like the layout of the buttons and the quick settings button -- and the touchscreen and dedicated keys/control pad makes everything even better! Do I recommend this camera -- YES! Amazing camera, amazing pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Camera is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Camera is amazing but the only problem I have is the charger and the missing HDMI cord. The charger worked on day 1. It's been over a week of owning this and it's time for a recharge... What do you know... The charger is doesn't work all of a sudden and now I can't use my awesome camera. Also where is the HDMI cord that was supposed to come with this? Regardless, the time I had with the T4i has been beautiful. It really is a wonderful camera and I'm glad I didn't get the recalled version!
customer_reviews.author: Pa May

customer_reviews.title: Camera that's built for beginners or pros
customer_reviews.text: I'm a complete novice when it comes to photography but let me tell you this camera will get you going with the automatic setting till you start actually learning to do manual photos. I would recommend to get the for dummies for this camera because it's a great way to learn how to shoot various shots in different situations. Also the 1080p recording is great, especially when I used it for SXSW in Austin this year, all my shows were recorded nice and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Persian Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Best Rebel I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: There are dozens of reviews on the Web for this camera and I'm not going there. This one is way better than my 3 year old Rebel. Auto focus is very good on this camera. It will just about focus in the dark. It has a sensor on the back that turns off the display when you go to look through the viewfinder. My Metz flash that I already had works fine with this camera and so does my Tamron 10-24 lens. I have no post-purchase regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Fenster

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from an EOS 40D. I am so happy with all the little extra's this camera offers along with the easy to use flip out screen. Anyone can use the manual mode successfully without having to use a guide book. They make it so simple! Plus I can record a video. I just purchased an expensive microphone so there is no need to bring a video camera for special occasions. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen E. Profera

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Novice
customer_reviews.text: I've only ever owned point and shoot cameras, and I have always been unhappy with the quality of my photos. Thinking of what I spent on all the cameras I was unhappy with, I could have bought the T4i twice. I'm glad I finally made the right decision. This camera takes beautiful, sharp pictures with no effort or skill on my part. I immediately became interested in macro photography, so now I'm messing around with that. And, quality pictures of my two toddlers are filling up my cloud storage. Time for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Phares

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, just as described, perfect, and awesome upgrade from the wife's Rebel XT. Plus it shoots 1080 HD!?!? Great camera, right out of the box, its taking AMAZING pictures. I don't think you can take a bad picture with a camera that can think for itself! When you look through the viewfinder, it automatically shuts off the LCD to prevent any glare! What camera does that?!?! Definately not the XT! Would buy again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: C3Killer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this more as an Impulse purchase. The camera is great quality, the pictures are excellent. While there is a learning curve coming from point and shoot to DSLR it's not too bad if you take the time to read. There was a grip recall, the camera I recieved did not have the issue and was already fixed. There is a newer model now about to ship, the t5i, but I haven't seen any new features to make me want it over this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace and older Rebel that I had problems with. Tis is a very good camera. Easy to use and the image stabilizer is amazing. I especially like the ISO setting. All of the settings are touch screen. Very well done. I thought the price was reasonable. I bought it through Amamzon and saved probably 70.00 compared the the box stores. The video works very nice. You have to buy a faster card for the video. I have used Canon cameras for 40 years. This one is very nice. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: James Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for beginners as well as advanced users. I use it for its HD Video recording. With the right settings and the right lenses this camera can capture AMAZING film like footage. When I'm not using it, my wife uses it to capture some beautiful stills of our children. The lens it comes with is nice but a bit on the slow side, meaning it needs a lot of light. But it gets a pretty image.
customer_reviews.author: ZiplinePete

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel t4i
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping i ordered the Camera on a Saturday and had it home by Tuesday. The Camera is really Nice its an upgrade from regular non Digital Camera. I take pictures of nature and the outdoors, Desert, Mountains, Beach it works really nice and Canon has other lenses. I have the standard 18-55 which is ok for indoors, I will research other lenses for telephoto pictures maybe the 55-250 see how that works out. I'm no Camera expert but this serves my simple needs and its a nice upgrade to DSLR from what i had.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Second DSLR, amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a nikon d5000. It just came in the mail, it did come a day late, i ordered ovenight shipping and it came in 2 days but it still came very quickly and it works amazing. the battery makes a high pitched whine while charging up. but the camera is great and comes with a strap, cables, battery and cover, lens, and covers, body, and cover,and instructions, and charger. very good camera. you could be a novice and this camera would make your photos look great.
customer_reviews.author: Mattk

customer_reviews.title: Takes excellent pictures, touchscreen really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is indubitably one of the best camera purchases I have ever made. I've been through a lot of point-and-shoot cameras and decided to splurge on a nice DSLR, and I'm really happy that this is the one I chose. It's user-friendly and takes high-quality pictures; what more could you ask for? If you're starting to enter the realm of DSLR cameras, this is definitely a good start!
customer_reviews.author: Crindee

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: From an amateur's perspective, this camera has way more features than I could ever hope to use. But the nice part about it is that it will grow with me. It is simple to learn. Videos online about it are thoroughly amazing. CameraRecToby has done an excellent series of videos on this. A friend of mine owns a T3i and finds that it is very similar except for a few minor changes. I'm happy to get the newer one, but if you think you are going to have to sacrifice another $100 for the upgrade, I wouldn't do it. But I love my camera. Having way to much fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Warren

customer_reviews.title: Best Rebel so far
customer_reviews.text: It's been 4 months, I purposely waited to write this review. I have to say I am very happy with it. This is my first DSLR camera, I am just a newbie, the touch screen was a big plus! noted: ISO over 1600 will get very noisy. Wish Canon had put a second screen on the top part of camera like the 60D. For the money, This is a great quality camera with lots of funtions and features. Recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Lee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera. It will take some time to master all the features - but my worst picture on this camera so far is still better than my best on any other camera I have. I cannot complain at all about this camera and am pleased as punch that I chose this camera over the others I looked at. I would definately buy this again. Purchased with the 18-135mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Bujak

customer_reviews.title: Great SLR camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to film real estate videos. It works great but not with the kit lens. You really need a 10mm wide angle for that and after I bought one of those, I had what I needed. I film manual so I can't really talk about the auto-focus in video, I don't really think it's a good idea for video, but others may find it useful. I do love the touchscreen however.
customer_reviews.author: Donald James

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures without much experience
customer_reviews.text: This camera is my first semi-professional one and does a great job. The handling is easy and the different functions are quickly learned. I took it with me on a few trips already and was surprised that the camera didn't bother me much. Not too heavy or anything. But for great pictures on wide and close angles you should spend the extra dollars and get both lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Nils und Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful camera especially for the wanna be professional. You can learn how to take nice professional looking pics even though you really are just a stay at home mom! And if you do not want to bother using all the features...there is always the option to set it on auto and just let the camera do its own thing. Still get good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Bambs

customer_reviews.title: Definitely impressed and happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product as a gift for my cousin, I'm not really into cameras myself but I was there when he opened the box and began using the camera. Right away I was blown away by the quality of pictures and the ease of use. Definitely impressed and happy with this product. packaging and equipment came as described in the post no complaints about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Great starter dslr
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for a while and it's a great camera. Even more than that I think it would be great for someone looking to get into photography. It's easy to use and it also has all the features you'd want to start getting "serious" about photography.
customer_reviews.author: happygolucky

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen is great and the AF works wonderfully. This is more first camera on the expensive side, but I've always taken pictures, usually using my $100 Canon Cameras. I would definitely recommend this to any first time camera purchaser. The touch screen is awesome and the camera itself is user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: April D. Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen makes this camera. I purchased this several months ago and questioned if the T4i was worth the extra money over the T3i at the time, because the only notable difference was the touch screen it seemed. I must say, as someone who has used both camera extensively, the touch screen actually makes a pretty huge difference. They have the same functions and do the same things, but the ease of use with the touch screen on the T4i makes it a much more painless experience. Other then that, the camera itself is great. Quality is a good and is a good start for anyone looking to get into a more pro-level styled camera.
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. My son finished a year of photography and just loves this camera. He took a picture outside, AT NIGHT, and it came out clear as day! He also took some incredible pictures of lightning! I must say, it is too confusing for me to use but if you are looking for a good digital SLR with good video capabilities, this is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shiree

customer_reviews.title: Canon T4i is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought the camera to shoot my son's football, baseball and my daughters swim events. It works great with the IS II 55mm lens. I have an old 300mm that focuses a bit too slowly for it when using the fast shots, but I'll take care of that at Christmas :-) I'm enjoying it and I haven't used a 300 for some time -- it was easy to pick up again.
customer_reviews.author: DBzD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I looked at several different products and after speaking with several folks about it, this one was right up my alley. If you want a camera that's a lot better than a pocket camera, but you don't want to pay the price for a professional camera, this is for you. I suggest buying a nice lens for the camera as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera! Watch tutorials and read the manuel!
customer_reviews.text: It's a GREAT middle cost DSLR. It does so many things. You just have to learn how to do them. This is a Professional camera and your pictures will turn out like crap if you don't understand shutter speed, ISO, and aperature. So make sure you learn these things before trying to take pics like a professional. And this is a good camera to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Just Love it
customer_reviews.text: Not being a rich person as myself, I don't think you can beat this camera for the price. I was amazed how well it takes pictures from almost no light to sunlight. It is also very fast and with all the features this camera has to offer, I just can't imagine anyone that wouldn't be very happy with buying one.
customer_reviews.author: Willie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for HD video.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use for HD video and I love it. Before I purchased it, I thought the touch screen was just a fun, pointless feature. It's actually been very useful. When I'm capturing more documentary style videos, it's great to be able to change the exposure and other features on the fly. All around this camera has great features for video, but I can't vouch for the photo side.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G. Bender

customer_reviews.title: First DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Very easy to use, and the price dropped when I added the 55-250mm to the purchase. It takes great photos and, it's lightweight. I defiantly recommend it. It's only down fall is the servos in the lens make noise when running AF during video. Pickup an external mic to get around it. Other then that, I have no problems. I picked it up around December 15th and have shot about 3,000 photos with it since then.
customer_reviews.author: Surgenet

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for budget photographers and videographers like me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the T4i after a spending a lot of time doing research, and looking at my budget, and came to the conclusion that if you are only functioning in the semi-professional realm of photography and videography, spending more for a better camera isn't worth the money, but this one is great. It's easy to use, and outputs a GREAT picture.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Cornett

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy of my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have done many projects with this camera and it has been making my projects look professional. I am very happy of my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Korin Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great First DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I've had several 35mm SLR's and a few Digital cameras, but this is my first Digital SLR. It is light, and has enough features to take me well beyond the basics of photography. Combined with a book like "David Bush's CANON EOS REBEL T4i/650D" makes this a very satisfying way to boost my skill level.
customer_reviews.author: Harold P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Too late for old dogs?
customer_reviews.text: The challenge for this amateur is to take the time to read and re-read the manual and field guide so that the major features can be put to use by instinct instead of constant reference to printed matter. At age eighty, I'm not sure I have that much time but i"m going to give it my best effort. I expect to enjoy the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbird

customer_reviews.title: After a few months camera won’t turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera at the beginning of 2020 and it seemed it work fine. Now, months later it doesn’t even turn on. For the amount of money I paid this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for getting started...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this camera after doing mass amounts of research and I am very happy with my choice. I am just getting into photography and I am having no problem learning/understanding how to use this camera in manual mode. I highly suggest getting the book "From Snapshots to Great Shots" by Jeff Revell for this camera model. It has helped me learn much more about this camera beyond the owners manual.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Totally happy with this entry Cam
customer_reviews.text: The camera functions perfectly for what I need it. I'm just starting with digital dslrs and it brings all the features that I might need so far. The only thing I can regret is that the kit lens is not compfortable as the focusing ring is on the front. I would have purchased if possible the new version that comes with the t5i (which I think is practicly the same camera for extra money). Other disadvantage it has is the autofocus function in live view mode. It is not as good as adverticed. Other than that, the camera is perfect. Built quality is ok, feels sturdy and if you add a battery grip to it it feels definitively professional.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis O.

customer_reviews.title: If it makes the wife happy, it makes me happy
customer_reviews.text: If it makes the wife happy, it makes me happy. It makes her happy. I don't use it, well, except for a few times. I'm no photographer....but it was easy. She has since taken some photog classes, and really has opened up the possibilities of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This a great all around camera. I have captured some amazing video, family pictures, and landscape pictures while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany GTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about a year. Cuts off in the middle of filming. My canon printer was the same way. I stopped buying their products.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kim

customer_reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR THE BUCK!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so simple and is just as easy as a point and click camera. You dont have to go into all the settings to take a great picture. Just wait until you are more comfortable with the camera. I love it and highly recommend it. I almost went with the Nikon 5200. Glad I didn't. Just dont skimp when you get different lenses. You spend the money on a great lens, it only enhances this camera. This is just my opinion. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: JDExtraZ

customer_reviews.title: Everything an Amateur/Beginner could ask for
customer_reviews.text: I Am a beginner photography enthusiast and I have had this camera for about a year. I love it. It has all of the modes necessary if you do not want to mess with manual mode. Video on this camera is very competitive compared to more expensive DSLRs. The touch screen is very responsive and clear. Its a wonderful camera for the price. For any beginner. I have dropped this camera about 4 ft onto a carpet and it is fine. The camera Kind of gave my bag a rubber smell. Overall i LOVE it
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Same camera as the t5i for significantly less $
customer_reviews.text: I chose this camera after 6months of research...it's a great camera for beginners (me) at least. Touch screen sounds silly, but is a great addition. Canon is stopping production of these to force you to buy the t5i for more money. Buy it now!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Upton

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Camera. I have used this Camera for Weddings, Birthday's, Anniversary's, Church, and so much more, and had really Great Pictures. And I love the Software that comes with it. Really Would Recommend this Camera for Beginner's and Professionals.

product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel T4i DSLR with 18-55mm EF-S IS II Lens (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Canon is proud to introduce its most sophisticated Rebel ever—the EOS Rebel T4i DSLR! Built to make advanced photography simple and fun, the new Rebel T4i delivers phenomenal image quality, high performance, and fast, intuitive operation. This EOS Rebel amps up the speed with the powerful DIGIC 5 Image Processor that helps make high-speed continuous shooting of up to 5.0 fps possible—great for capturing fast action. An 18.0 Megapixel CMOS sensor ensures that every image is shot in superb, high resolution; and an extended ISO range of 100–12800 gives photographers the opportunities to take the Rebel T4i into more shooting situations than ever before. A 9-point all cross-type AF system (including a high-precision dual cross f/2.8 center point) delivers improved autofocus performance, and a new Hybrid CMOS AF System increases autofocus speed when shooting photos and video in Live View. For users interested in creating impressive videos, the Rebel T4i is ready to help you create your next masterpiece. Movie Servo AF provides continuous focus of moving subjects, so you never miss a moment. A built-in stereo microphone and manual audio level adjustment helps ensure that your audio will match the stunning quality of your video. First ever for an EOS Rebel, the Rebel T4i features a Vari-angle Touch Screen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II, which allows fast and intuitive camera operation. Add compatibility with Canon’s proven EF and EF-S lenses and a slew of EOS accessories, the Rebel T4i is an incredibly versatile tool for creating the images and videos you envision.What’s in the box: Canon EOS Rebel T4i Digital Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II Lens, Eyecup Ef for Digital Rebel Cameras, R-F-3 Camera Cover, EW-100DB IV Wide Strap, LC-E8E Battery Charger, LP-E8 Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery Pack (7.2V, 1120mAh), USB Interface Cable IFC-130U, EOS Digital Solution Disk v.25.1, Camera Instruction Manual, Software Instruction Manual CD and 1-Year Limited Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


INSPIRATION ON DEMAND
Canon is proud to introduce its most sophisticated Rebel ever—the EOS Rebel T4i DSLR! Built to make advanced photography simple and fun, the new Rebel T4i delivers phenomenal image quality, high performance, and fast, intuitive operation. This EOS Rebel amps up the speed with the powerful DIGIC 5 Image Processor that helps make high-speed continuous shooting of up to 5.0 fps possible—great for capturing fast action. An 18.0 Megapixel CMOS sensor ensures that every image is shot in superb, high resolution; and an extended ISO range of 100–12800 gives photographers the opportunities to take the Rebel T4i into more shooting situations than ever before. A 9-point all cross-type AF system (including a high-precision dual cross f/2.8 center point) delivers improved autofocus performance, and a new Hybrid CMOS AF System increases autofocus speed when shooting photos and video in Live View. For users interested in creating impressive videos, the Rebel T4i is ready to help you create your next masterpiece. Movie Servo AF provides continuous focus of moving subjects, so you never miss a moment. A built-in stereo microphone and manual audio level adjustment helps ensure that your audio will match the stunning quality of your video. First ever for an EOS Rebel, the Rebel T4i features a Vari-angle Touch Screen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II, which allows fast and intuitive camera operation. Add compatibility with Canon’s proven EF and EF-S lenses and a slew of EOS accessories, the Rebel T4i is an incredibly versatile tool for creating the images and videos you envision.

AMAZING CAPTURE AND PROCESSING POWER
18.0 MEGAPIXEL CMOS (APS-C) SENSOR
The EOS Rebel T4i features Canon’s amazing 18.0 Megapixel CMOS (Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor) sensor. Perfect for enlargements or for cropping detailed portions of the composition, the EOS Rebel T4i’s sensor captures images with exceptional clarity and tonal range. This first-class sensor features many of the same new technologies used by professional Canon cameras to maximize each pixel’s light-gathering efficiency and has center pixels that aid in the EOS Rebel T4i’s accurate AF performance. This APS-C size sensor creates an effective 1.6x field of view (compared to 35mm format).

14-BIT A/D CONVERSION
With 14-bit analog-to-digital conversion, the EOS Rebel T4i captures and records images with remarkable gradations and detail in subtle tones and colors, resulting in more realistic and detailed images. By recording up to 16,384 colors per channel the EOS Rebel T4i ensures that the fine detail found in subjects like foliage, sky and water are preserved and recorded with a tremendous level of accuracy, ensuring gorgeous results.

ISO 100–12800 AND EXPANDABLE TO 25600 IN H MODE
Thanks to its new DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the EOS Rebel T4i features an expanded ISO range of ISO 100–12800 (expandable to 25600 in H mode) that makes shooting possible in situations previously unthinkable without flash. The Rebel T4i, with the DIGIC 5 Image Processor’s remarkable noise-reduction technology sets a new standard for Rebel cameras and low-light photography. Along with one of Canon’s EF or EF-S lenses with Optical Image Stabilizer, the EOS Rebel T4i can record beautiful images even when light sources are scarce.

DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The Rebel T4i is the first Rebel to feature Canon’s DIGIC 5 Image Processor. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the camera’s CMOS sensor to deliver images with incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor the Rebel T4i can achieve higher ISO sensitivity, can shoot up to 5.0 fps continuously and can even perform advanced functions like HDR Backlight Control, art filters, lens correction and much more. The brilliant “brain” of the camera, this imaging engine supercharges every facet of still and moving image capture.

THE FASTEST REBEL YET!
HIGH-SPEED CONTINUOUS SHOOTING
A Rebel first, the EOS Rebel T4i can shoot up to 5.0 frames per second, continuously. Thanks to improvements in the shutter mechanism, the mirror drive and the camera’s sensor, the EOS Rebel T4i is ready for action; whether capturing that perfect expression, the game’s winning goal, or the bride walking down the aisle, the EOS Rebel T4i delivers the speed and performance to guarantee results.

ENHANCED AF SYSTEMS TAILORED FOR PERFECT STILLS AND VIDEO
IMPROVED AUTOFOCUS PERFORMANCE AND NEW HYBRID CMOS AF
The EOS Rebel T4i is equipped with AF features that ensure speedy, accurate and continuous AF every time. When shooting through the viewfinder, the EOS Rebel T4i has improved autofocus with a new 9-point, all cross-type AF system (including high-precision dual-cross f/2.8 center point) for accurate focus whether the camera is oriented in portrait or landscape position. A new AI Servo AF system achieves and maintains consistent focus with an exceptional degree of reliability.

The EOS Rebel T4i features Canon’s amazing new Hybrid CMOS AF System, perfect for shooting photos and video in Live View. This new system combines two distinct AF technologies, phase and contrast detection AF, for speedier and more accurate focus. These complementary focusing systems are aided by pixels on the camera’s CMOS sensor that assist in predicting subject location; therefore making continuous focus tracking quick and accurate in video recording while enhancing focusing speed.

TRUE HD PERFORMANCE, REBEL SIMPLICITY
ENHANCED EOS FULL HD MOVIE MODE WITH MOVIE SERVO AF
The EOS Rebel T4i offers easy to use, professional video capture without compromise. Capable of shooting in a number of recording sizes and frame rates the Rebel T4i sets a whole new standard for performance, quality and simplicity. The Rebel T4i enables easy manual control of exposure, focus and Live View features, even in-camera editing! New Movie Servo AF allows continuous autofocus tracking of moving subjects while recording video. When shooting video with one of Canon’s new STM lenses, Movie Servo AF takes advantage of the lens’ stepping motor for smooth and quiet continuous AF. With an STM lens attached, the EOS Rebel T4i sets a new standard for SLR moviemaking performance!

Resolution & Recording Sizes Frame Rates Full HD
1920 x 1080
16:9 format 30 fps (29.97) 25 fps – PAL standard 24 fps (23.976) HD
1280 x 720
16:9 format 60 fps (59.94) 50 fps – PAL standard Standard Definition (SD)
640 x 480 30 fps (29.97) 25 fps – PAL standard 
BUILT-IN STEREO MICROPHONE, MANUAL AUDIO LEVEL ADJUSTMENT
The EOS Rebel T4i has an internal stereo microphone for improved audio capture and a wind filter feature to reduce wind noise when shooting outdoors. Sound recording levels can be manually (up to 64 different levels) or automatically controlled. A built-in attenuator is also provided to reduce audio clipping. For more advanced audio recording, the Rebel T4i is compatible with many third-party electret condenser microphones with a 3.5mm diameter plug.

VIDEO SNAPSHOT
With the Video Snapshot feature, the EOS Rebel T4i DSLR can capture short video clips (of 2, 4 or 8 seconds) then combine them automatically into one video file as a snapshot or highlights â€œalbum.â€ With no editing needed after shooting, the compiled video is perfect for sharing online or displaying directly on an HDTV via the camera’s HDMI port. Additionally, stills can be recorded during video shooting simply by pressing the camera’s shutter button. During playback, video clips in an album can now be reordered or deleted.

SHARP AND CLEAR, WITH TACTILE CONTROLS
NEW VARI-ANGLE TOUCH SCREEN 3.0-INCH CLEAR VIEW LCD MONITOR II WITH MULTI-TOUCH OPERATION AND TOUCH AF
The EOS Rebel T4i comes with a newly engineered, Vari-angle Touch Screen 3.0-inch Clear View LCD monitor II. Using the same capacitive technology as today’s popular mobile devices, this new screen is touch-sensitive and delivers intuitive touch panel operation. Two finger touch gestures (multi-touch) can be used for zooming or changing images, menu and quick control settings can be accessed, and focus point and shutter release can be activated with the touch of a fingertip. Displaying fine detail (at approximately 1.04 million dots), this screen is perfect for composing and reviewing images. Thanks to a new, solid construction between the monitor’s resin-coated cover and the liquid crystal display, reflections are minimized, and the display can be viewed, without glare, from any number of angles. The LCD’s surface is treated with a smudge-resistant coating to minimize fingerprints and maintain a bright, clear image display.

COMPLEX FUNCTIONS MADE SIMPLE
SCENE INTELLIGENT AUTO MODE
The EOS Rebel T4i features an enhanced Scene Intelligent Auto mode that incorporates a number of Canon technologies to deliver the best possible exposure. Joining Picture Style Auto, Automatic Lighting Optimizer, Automatic White Balance, Autofocus, and Automatic Exposure, Scene Intelligent Auto mode analyzes the image, accounting for faces, colors, brightness, moving objects, contrast, even whether the camera is handheld or on a tripod, and then chooses the exposure and enhancements that bring out the best in any scene or situation.

NEW EFFECTS FOR DRAMATIC AND GORGEOUS RESULTS
HANDHELD NIGHT SCENE MODE
Accessible right on the EOS Rebel T4i’s Mode Dial, Handheld Night Scene mode captures nightscapes with bright highlights and detailed dark areas, delivering results previously impossible without the use of a tripod. By shooting and combining four consecutive shots at a shutter speed fast enough to avoid camera shake, the EOS Rebel T4i’s Handheld Night Scene mode makes dramatic nighttime photography simple.

HDR BACKLIGHT CONTROL MODE
The EOS Rebel T4i’s HDR Backlight Control mode ensures that backlit subjects are not recorded too dark. By shooting three consecutive shots at different exposures (underexposed, correctly exposed and overexposed) and then combining the images, the final result maintains detail in both the shadow and highlight areas, ensuring the backlit subject is properly exposed.

SEVEN CREATIVE FILTERS, PLUS NEW ART BOLD EFFECT AND WATER PAINTING EFFECT
To add to the fun and creative possibilities available with the EOS Rebel T4i, seven different creative filters that can dramatically alter the mood and visual effect of any particular scene. Creative Filters include Grainy Black and White, Soft Focus, Fish-eye Effect, Toy Camera Effect, Miniature Effect and new filters, Art Bold Effect (makes the photos look like an oil painting, with subjects appearing three-dimensional), and Water Painting Effect (photos are altered to look like a water-colored painting). Since the filters can be applied to the image after shooting, it’s easy to try several effects on the same shot.

CLEANER IMAGES, EVEN AT HIGH ISO
MULTI SHOT NOISE REDUCTION
To enhance its already admirable high ISO shooting capabilities, the EOS Rebel T4i features an intelligent Multi Shot Noise Reduction tool that reduces noise even further than the camera’s sensor and the DIGIC 5 Image Processor alone. With Multi Shot Noise Reduction activated, the camera takes four consecutive shots, merges and aligns them. This eliminates more noise than the Rebel’s traditional Noise Reduction filter, with little or no apparent resolution loss. Moving subjects are even optimized to minimize subject blur! Thanks to this clever new feature, high ISO shooting has never looked better. 

FLEXIBLE AND RELIABLE RECORDING
COMPATIBILITY WITH SD/SDHC/SDXC MEMORY CARDS, INCLUDING NEW ULTRA HIGH SPEED CARDS
The EOS Rebel T4i uses popular SD, SDHC, SDXC and is even compatible with the newest Ultra High Speed (UHS-I) memory cards. Compact and available in large capacities, SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards are a perfect complement to the EOS Rebel T4i’s compact design.

Additionally, the EOS Rebel T4i is compatible with Eye-Fi∗ SD cards, which are outfitted with a Wi-Fi® transmitter (IEEE 802.11b/g) and an internal antenna for wireless, high-speed transfer of images. With an Eye-Fi card installed, the EOS Rebel T4i can display the Eye-Fi’s connection status and error notes with ease, for fully functional wireless uploading of images directly from the camera.

∗Canon cameras are not guaranteed to support Eye-Fi card functions, including wireless transfer. In case of an issue with the Eye-Fi card, please consult with the card manufacturer. The use of Eye-Fi cards may not be available outside the United States and Canada; please contact the card manufacturer for territory availability.

A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF OPTICS PERFECT FOR VIDEO AND STILLS
COMPATIBLE WITH EF AND EF-S LENSES
The EOS Rebel T4i is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF lineup, including compact and lightweight EF-S lenses, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses and including the new STM series optimized for video shooting. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver outstanding performance and deliver beautiful results. Special technologies like Canon’s Image Stabilizer technology help to minimize the effect of camera shake, effectively adding up to four stops of light; STM lenses even feature a stepping motor for smooth and quiet continuous autofocus while capturing video. With an array of lenses perfect for travel, sports, still life and everything in between, photographers can truly maximize the quality and performance of their EOS Rebel T4i.

MORE FEATURES FOR INCREASED VERSATILITY
LENS ABERRATION CORRECTION
The EOS Rebel T4i features lens correction tools that compensate for lens characteristics that can affect overall image quality. The EOS Rebel T4i’s lens peripheral illumination correction feature corrects light falloff in the corner of the image according to the characteristics of the lens being used. It even has correction data for a number of popular lenses stored in its memory. With the EOS Rebel T4i’s new chromatic aberration correction tool, distracting color fringing can be corrected at the time of shooting.

FEATURE GUIDE
To help explain the specific function of features found on the EOS Rebel T4i, the feature guide displays a simple description helpful in determining the applicability for the situation at hand. It is displayed in each shooting mode, during mode dial operations, and for Quick Control screen functions. It appears automatically when a function is selected—a lifesaver when trying to determine the best mode or function for the next picture. The feature guide works automatically by default, and can be disabled easily through the camera’s menu.

GPS COMPATIBLE
With the optional GPS Receiver GP-E2 attached to the hot shoe or the digital terminal, the EOS Rebel T4i can record location, including latitude, longitude and altitude, plus can track the trajectory of movement with its logging function. An electric compass records the camera’s orientation during each shot, and world time information is recorded through GPS syncing.

JPEG RESIZING
To create images suitable for sharing by email or online, the EOS Rebel T4i can resize JPEG files, in camera, of varying pixels (aspect ratio cannot be changed, only the image size can be decreased) while leaving the original image untouched.

PHOTOBOOK SET-UP
Photographers can share their images in book form with the EOS Rebel T4i’s convenient Photobook Set-up feature. Users can easily choose specific images, images in a folder and even all images, then specify their sequence and layout. The results can be printed in book form, with ease.

IMAGE RATING
To help organize images recorded to the camera’s storage, the EOS Rebel T4i makes it simple to rate individual images from one star to five. Therefore, image browsing, printing and slide shows can be based upon those ratings.
